DataElement.preferredName: Allogeneic Tissue Donor Greater Than or Equal To 1 Unit Autologous Blood Product Donation Collection Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the allogeneic tissue donor gave one or more units of autologous blood product collections.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Allogeneic Tissue Donor Greater Than or Equal To 1 Unit Autologous Blood Product Donation Collection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Taken from different individuals of the same species._Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1_A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else._Blood or blood product donations intended for transfusion at a later time to the donor._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Allogeneic Tissue Donor Greater Than or Equal To Integer::1 Unit Autologous Blood Product Donation
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Taken from different individuals of the same species.:Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1:A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else.:Blood or blood product donations intended for transfusion at a later time to the donor.

Concepts.definition: Taken from different individuals of the same species.
Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else.
Blood or blood product donations intended for transfusion at a later time to the donor.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of gathering something together.

Concepts.definition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
